goal.ch: Enable students to understand the essential functions of the mobile robot comprehensively, such as actuation, localization, and navigation. In this course, localization and navigation will be introduced not only orally but explained with probability and linear algebra for formal, rigorous, and insightful illustration. Parts of the course contents will be practiced and validated through several simulations and projects.
goal.en: Enable students to understand the essential functions of the mobile robot comprehensively, such as actuation, localization, and navigation. In this course, localization and navigation will be introduced not only orally but explained with probability and linear algebra for formal, rigorous, and insightful illustration. Parts of the course contents will be practiced and validated through several simulations and projects.

outline.ch:
Review previous knowledge (linear algebra, state space, probability)
System dynamic with noise
State estimation
Localization ＆ Mapping
Path planning
Trajectory planning
Actuation illustration
Experiments:
ROS2 Installation and Manipulation
MATLAB Simulink for mobile robot modeling
MATLAB Kalman filter visualization
MATLAB Path Planning
ROS2 Rviz ＆ Gazebo
Real AMR teaching aid manipulation
outline.en:
Review previous knowledge (linear algebra, state space, probability)
System dynamic with noise
State estimation
Localization ＆ Mapping
Path planning

Experiments:

MATLAB Simulink for mobile robot modeling
MATLAB Kalman filter visualization
MATLAB Path Planning
ROS2 Rviz ＆ Gazebo
Real AMR teaching aid manipulation

textbook.ch:
Lecture notes

Reference:
“Probabilistic robotics,” Sebastian Thrun, W. Burgard, D. Fox
“State estimation for robotics,” Timothy D. Barfoot
“Introduction to Autonomous Mobile Robot,” Roland Siegwart, Illah Reza Nourbakhsh, Davide Scaramuzza
